title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: The Open Type dialog in JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') etc. These obfuscated classes are currently displayed prominently in the dialog, causing confusion.
OB: Currently, the obfuscated classes show up prominently in the Open Type dialog.
EB: The obfuscated classes should be either sorted lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter or completely filtered out from the Open Type dialog.
SR: To reproduce the issue: Open the Open Type dialog in JDK 1.4. Observe that obfuscated classes are displayed prominently. To fix this issue: a) Sort the lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter. b) Alternatively, filter out the obfuscated classes completely.
